name: CKEDITOR.plugins.widget.nestedEditable
doc:
The wrapper class for editable elements inside widgets.

Do not use directly. Use CKEDITOR.plugins.widget.definition.editables or CKEDITOR.plugins.widget.initEditable.

members.doc:
The native DOM object represented by this class instance.

var element = new CKEDITOR.dom.element( 'span' );
alert( element.$.nodeType ); // '1'
members.short_doc: The native DOM object represented by this class instance. ...

members.name: editor
members.doc: The editor instance.

members.name: enterMode
members.doc: The enter mode active in this editable. It is determined from editable's name (whether it is a blockless editable), its allowed content rules (if defined) and the default editor's mode.
members.short_doc: The enter mode active in this editable. ...

members.name: filter
members.doc: The filter instance if allowed content rules were defined.

members.name: shiftEnterMode
members.doc: The shift enter move active in this editable.

members.name: type
members.doc: The node type. This is a constant value set to CKEDITOR.NODE_ELEMENT.
members.short_doc: The node type. ...

members.name: constructor
addClass
members.doc:
Adds a CSS class to the element. It appends the class to the already existing names.

var element = new CKEDITOR.dom.element( 'div' );
element.addClass( 'classA' ); // <div class="classA">
element.addClass( 'classB' ); // <div class="classA classB">
element.addClass( 'classA' ); // <div class="classA classB">

params.name: className
params.doc: The name of the class to be added.

members.short_doc: Adds a CSS class to the element. ...

members.name: append
members.doc:
Append a node as a child of this element.

var p = new CKEDITOR.dom.element( 'p' );

var strong = new CKEDITOR.dom.element( 'strong' );
p.append( strong );

var em = p.append( 'em' );

// Result: '<p><strong></strong><em></em></p>'

params.name: node
params.doc: The node or element name to be appended.

params.name: toStart
params.doc: Indicates that the element is to be appended at the start.

members.short_doc: Append a node as a child of this element. ...

members.name: appendBogus
members.doc: Appends a <br> filler element to this element if the filler is not present already. By default filler is appended only if CKEDITOR.env.needsBrFiller is true, however when force is set to true filler will be appended regardless of the environment.
members.short_doc: Appends a <br> filler element to this element if the filler is not present already. ...

members.name: appendHtml
members.doc: Append HTML as a child(ren) of this element.
members.short_doc: Append HTML as a child(ren) of this element. ...

members.name: appendText
members.doc:
Append text to this element.

var p = new CKEDITOR.dom.element( 'p' );
p.appendText( 'This is' );
p.appendText( ' some text' );

// Result: '<p>This is some text</p>'
members.short_doc: Append text to this element. ...

members.name: appendTo
members.doc:
Makes this node a child of another element.

var p = new CKEDITOR.dom.element( 'p' );
var strong = new CKEDITOR.dom.element( 'strong' );
strong.appendTo( p );

// Result: '<p><strong></strong></p>'.

params.name: element
params.doc: The target element to which this node will be appended.

members.short_doc: Makes this node a child of another element. ...

members.name: breakParent
members.doc:
Breaks one of the ancestor element in the element position, moving this element between the broken parts.

// Before breaking:
//      <b>This <i>is some<span /> sample</i> test text</b>
// If "element" is <span /> and "parent" is <i>:
//      <b>This <i>is some</i><span /><i> sample</i> test text</b>
element.breakParent( parent );

// Before breaking:
//      <b>This <i>is some<span /> sample</i> test text</b>
// If "element" is <span /> and "parent" is <b>:
//      <b>This <i>is some</i></b><span /><b><i> sample</i> test text</b>
element.breakParent( parent );
members.short_doc:
Breaks one of the ancestor element in the element position, moving
this element between the broken parts. ...

members.name: capture
members.doc: Register event handler under the capturing stage on supported target.
members.short_doc: Register event handler under the capturing stage on supported target. ...

members.name: clearCustomData
members.doc: Removes any data stored on this object. To avoid memory leaks we must assure that there are no references left after the object is no longer needed.
members.short_doc: Removes any data stored on this object. ...

members.name: clone
members.doc:
Clone this node.

Note: Values set by {setCustomData} won't be available in the clone.

params.name: includeChildren
params.doc: If true then all node's children will be cloned recursively.

params.name: cloneId
params.doc: Whether ID attributes should be cloned too.

members.short_doc: Clone this node. ...

members.name: contains
members.doc: Checks if this element contains given node.
members.short_doc: Checks if this element contains given node. ...

members.name: copyAttributes
members.doc: Copy all the attributes from one node to the other, kinda like a clone skipAttributes is an object with the attributes that must not be copied.
members.short_doc:
Copy all the attributes from one node to the other, kinda like a clone
skipAttributes is an object with the attribute...

members.name: data
members.doc:
Gets, sets and removes custom data to be stored as HTML5 data-* attributes.

element.data( 'extra-info', 'test' );   // Appended the attribute data-extra-info="test" to the element.
alert( element.data( 'extra-info' ) );  // 'test'
element.data( 'extra-info', false );    // Remove the data-extra-info attribute from the element.

params.name: name
params.doc: The name of the attribute, excluding the data- part.

params.name: value
params.doc: The value to set. If set to false, the attribute will be removed.

members.short_doc: Gets, sets and removes custom data to be stored as HTML5 data-* attributes. ...

members.name: define
members.doc: Predefine some intrinsic properties on a specific event name.

properties.name: errorProof
properties.doc: Whether the event firing should catch error thrown from a per listener call.

members.short_doc: Predefine some intrinsic properties on a specific event name. ...

members.name: disableContextMenu
members.doc: Disables browser's context menu in this element.
members.short_doc: Disables browser's context menu in this element. ...

members.name: equals
members.doc:
Determines whether the specified object is equal to the current object.

var doc = new CKEDITOR.dom.document( document );
alert( doc.equals( CKEDITOR.document ) );   // true
alert( doc == CKEDITOR.document );          // false

params.name: object
params.doc: The object to compare with the current object.

members.short_doc: Determines whether the specified object is equal to the current object. ...

members.name: find
members.doc:
Returns list of elements within this element that match specified selector.

Notes:

  • Not available in IE7.
  • Returned list is not a live collection (like a result of native querySelectorAll).

  • Unlike native querySelectorAll this method ensures selector contextualization. This is:

      HTML:       '<body><div><i>foo</i></div></body>'
  Native:     div.querySelectorAll( 'body i' ) // ->      [ <i>foo</i> ]
  Method:     div.find( 'body i' ) // ->                  []
              div.find( 'i' ) // ->                       [ <i>foo</i> ]
members.short_doc: Returns list of elements within this element that match specified selector. ...

members.name: findOne
members.doc:
Returns first element within this element that matches specified selector.

Notes:

  • Not available in IE7.

  • Unlike native querySelectorAll this method ensures selector contextualization. This is:

      HTML:       '<body><div><i>foo</i></div></body>'
  Native:     div.querySelector( 'body i' ) // ->         <i>foo</i>
  Method:     div.findOne( 'body i' ) // ->               null
              div.findOne( 'i' ) // ->                    <i>foo</i>
members.short_doc: Returns first element within this element that matches specified selector. ...

members.name: fire
members.doc:
Fires an specific event in the object. All registered listeners are called at this point.

someObject.on( 'someEvent', function() { ... } );
someObject.on( 'someEvent', function() { ... } );
someObject.fire( 'someEvent' );             // Both listeners are called.

someObject.on( 'someEvent', function( event ) {
    alert( event.data );                    // 'Example'
} );
someObject.fire( 'someEvent', 'Example' );

params.name: data
params.doc: Data to be sent as the CKEDITOR.eventInfo.data when calling the listeners.

params.name: editor
params.doc: The editor instance to send as the CKEDITOR.eventInfo.editor when calling the listener.

return.name: return
return.doc: A boolean indicating that the event is to be canceled, or data returned by one of the listeners.

members.short_doc: Fires an specific event in the object. ...

members.name: fireOnce
members.doc:
Fires an specific event in the object, releasing all listeners registered to that event. The same listeners are not called again on successive calls of it or of fire.

someObject.on( 'someEvent', function() { ... } );
someObject.fire( 'someEvent' );         // Above listener called.
someObject.fireOnce( 'someEvent' );     // Above listener called.
someObject.fire( 'someEvent' );         // No listeners called.

params.name: data
params.doc: Data to be sent as the CKEDITOR.eventInfo.data when calling the listeners.

params.name: editor
params.doc: The editor instance to send as the CKEDITOR.eventInfo.editor when calling the listener.

return.name: return
return.doc: A booloan indicating that the event is to be canceled, or data returned by one of the listeners.

members.short_doc:
Fires an specific event in the object, releasing all listeners
registered to that event. ...

members.name: focus
members.doc:
Moves the selection focus to this element.

var element = CKEDITOR.document.getById( 'myTextarea' );
element.focus();

params.name: defer
params.doc: Whether to asynchronously defer the execution by 100 ms.

members.short_doc: Moves the selection focus to this element. ...

members.name: focusNext
members.doc:
Moves the UI focus to the element following this element in the tabindex order.

var element = CKEDITOR.document.getById( 'example' );
element.focusNext();
members.short_doc: Moves the UI focus to the element following this element in the tabindex order. ...

members.name: focusPrevious
members.doc:
Moves the UI focus to the element before this element in the tabindex order.

var element = CKEDITOR.document.getById( 'example' );
element.focusPrevious();
members.short_doc: Moves the UI focus to the element before this element in the tabindex order. ...

members.name: forEach
members.doc:
Traverse the DOM of this element (inclusive), executing a callback for each node.

var element = CKEDITOR.dom.element.createFromHtml( '<div><p>foo<b>bar</b>bom</p></div>' );
element.forEach( function( node ) {
    console.log( node );
} );
// Will log:
// 1. <div> element,
// 2. <p> element,
// 3. "foo" text node,
// 4. <b> element,
// 5. "bar" text node,
// 6. "bom" text node.

params.name: callback
params.doc: Function to be executed on every node. If callback returns false descendants of the node will be ignored.

params.name: type
params.doc: If specified callback will be executed only on nodes of this type.

members.short_doc:
Traverse the DOM of this element (inclusive), executing a callback for
each node. ...

members.name: getAddress
members.doc:
Retrieves a uniquely identifiable tree address for this node. The tree address returned is an array of integers, with each integer indicating a child index of a DOM node, starting from document.documentElement.

For example, assuming <body> is the second child of <html> (<head> being the first), and we would like to address the third child under the fourth child of <body>, the tree address returned would be: [1, 3, 2].

The tree address cannot be used for finding back the DOM tree node once the DOM tree structure has been modified.
members.short_doc: Retrieves a uniquely identifiable tree address for this node. ...

members.name: getAscendant
members.doc:
Gets the closest ancestor node of this node, specified by its name.

// Suppose we have the following HTML structure:
// <div id="outer"><div id="inner"><p><b>Some text</b></p></div></div>
// If node == <b>
ascendant = node.getAscendant( 'div' );             // ascendant == <div id="inner">
ascendant = node.getAscendant( 'b' );               // ascendant == null
ascendant = node.getAscendant( 'b', true );         // ascendant == <b>
ascendant = node.getAscendant( { div:1,p:1 } );     // Searches for the first 'div' or 'p': ascendant == <div id="inner">

params.name: reference
params.doc: The name of the ancestor node to search or an object with the node names to search for.

params.name: includeSelf
params.doc: Whether to include the current node in the search.

return.name: return
return.doc: The located ancestor node or null if not found.

members.short_doc: Gets the closest ancestor node of this node, specified by its name. ...

members.name: getAttribute
members.doc:
Gets the value of an element attribute.

var element = CKEDITOR.dom.element.createFromHtml( '<input type="text" />' );
alert( element.getAttribute( 'type' ) ); // 'text'

return.name: return
return.doc: The attribute value or null if not defined.

members.short_doc: Gets the value of an element attribute. ...

members.name: getBogus
members.doc: Checks if there's a filler node at the end of an element, and returns it.
members.short_doc: Checks if there's a filler node at the end of an element, and returns it. ...

members.name: getChild
members.doc:
Gets a DOM tree descendant under the current node.

var strong = p.getChild( 0 );

params.name: indices
params.doc: The child index or array of child indices under the node.

return.name: return
return.doc: The specified DOM child under the current node. Null if child does not exist.

members.short_doc: Gets a DOM tree descendant under the current node. ...

members.name: getChildCount
members.doc: Gets number of element's children.
members.short_doc: Gets number of element's children. ...

members.name: getChildren
members.doc: Gets the nodes list containing all children of this element.
members.short_doc: Gets the nodes list containing all children of this element. ...

members.name: getClientRect
members.doc: Retrieve the bounding rectangle of the current element, in pixels, relative to the upper-left corner of the browser's client area.

return.name: return
return.doc: The dimensions of the DOM element including left, top, right, bottom, width and height.

members.short_doc:
Retrieve the bounding rectangle of the current element, in pixels,
relative to the upper-left corner of the browser's...

members.name: getComputedStyle
members.doc:
Gets the current computed value of one of the element CSS style properties.

var element = new CKEDITOR.dom.element( 'span' );
alert( element.getComputedStyle( 'display' ) ); // 'inline'
members.short_doc:
Gets the current computed value of one of the element CSS style
properties. ...

members.name: getCustomData
members.doc:
Gets the value set to a data slot in this object.

var element = new CKEDITOR.dom.element( 'span' );
alert( element.getCustomData( 'hasCustomData' ) );      // e.g. 'true'
alert( element.getCustomData( 'nonExistingKey' ) );     // null

params.name: key
params.doc: The key used to identify the data slot.

return.name: return
return.doc: This value set to the data slot.

members.short_doc: Gets the value set to a data slot in this object. ...

members.name: getData
members.doc: Gets the editable data. Like setData, this method will process and filter the data.
members.short_doc: Gets the editable data. ...

members.name: getDirection
members.doc: Gets element's direction. Supports both CSS direction prop and dir attr.
members.short_doc: Gets element's direction. ...

members.name: getDocument
members.doc:
Gets the document containing this element.

var element = CKEDITOR.document.getById( 'example' );
alert( element.getDocument().equals( CKEDITOR.document ) ); // true
members.short_doc: Gets the document containing this element. ...

members.name: getDocumentPosition
members.doc: Gets this element's position in document.
members.short_doc: Gets this element's position in document. ...

members.name: getDtd
members.doc: Gets the DTD entries for this element.

return.name: return
return.doc: An object containing the list of elements accepted by this element.

members.short_doc: Gets the DTD entries for this element. ...

members.name: getEditor
members.doc:
Retrieves an editor instance which is based on this element (if any). It basically loops over CKEDITOR.instances in search for an instance that uses the element.

var element = new CKEDITOR.dom.element( 'div' );
element.appendTo( CKEDITOR.document.getBody() );
CKEDITOR.replace( element );
alert( element.getEditor().name ); // 'editor1'

return.name: return
return.doc: An editor instance or null if nothing has been found.

members.short_doc: Retrieves an editor instance which is based on this element (if any). ...

members.name: getElementsByTag
members.doc: Gets all this element's descendants having given tag name.
members.short_doc: Gets all this element's descendants having given tag name. ...

members.name: getFirst
members.doc:
Gets the first child node of this element.

var element = CKEDITOR.dom.element.createFromHtml( '<div><b>Example</b></div>' );
var first = element.getFirst();
alert( first.getName() ); // 'b'

return.name: return
return.doc: The first child node or null if not available.

members.short_doc: Gets the first child node of this element. ...

members.name: getFrameDocument
members.doc: Returns the inner document of this <iframe> element.
members.short_doc: Returns the inner document of this <iframe> element. ...

members.name: getHtml
members.doc:
Gets the inner HTML of this element.

var element = CKEDITOR.dom.element.createFromHtml( '<div><b>Example</b></div>' );
alert( element.getHtml() ); // '<b>Example</b>'
members.short_doc: Gets the inner HTML of this element. ...

members.name: getId
members.doc:
Gets the value of the id attribute of this element.

var element = CKEDITOR.dom.element.createFromHtml( '<p id="myId"></p>' );
alert( element.getId() ); // 'myId'

return.name: return
return.doc: The element id, or null if not available.

members.short_doc: Gets the value of the id attribute of this element. ...

members.name: getIndex
members.doc:
Get index of a node in an array of its parent.childNodes.

Let's assume having childNodes array:

[ emptyText, element1, text, text, element2 ]
element1.getIndex();        // 1
element1.getIndex( true );  // 0
element2.getIndex();        // 4
element2.getIndex( true );  // 2

params.name: normalized
params.doc: When true empty text nodes and one followed by another one text node are not counted in.

members.short_doc: Get index of a node in an array of its parent.childNodes. ...

members.name: getLast
members.doc: See getFirst.
members.short_doc: See getFirst. ...

members.name: getName
members.doc:
Gets the element name (tag name). The returned name is guaranteed to be always full lowercased.

var element = new CKEDITOR.dom.element( 'span' );
alert( element.getName() ); // 'span'
members.short_doc: Gets the element name (tag name). ...

members.name: getNameAtt
members.doc:
Gets the value of the name attribute of this element.

var element = CKEDITOR.dom.element.createFromHtml( '<input name="myName"></input>' );
alert( <b>element.getNameAtt()</b> ); // 'myName'

return.name: return
return.doc: The element name, or null if not available.

members.short_doc: Gets the value of the name attribute of this element. ...

members.name: getNext
members.doc:
Gets the node that follows this element in its parent's child list.

var element = CKEDITOR.dom.element.createFromHtml( '<div><b>Example</b><i>next</i></div>' );
var last = element.getFirst().getNext();
alert( last.getName() ); // 'i'

return.name: return
return.doc: The next node or null if not available.

members.short_doc: Gets the node that follows this element in its parent's child list. ...

members.name: getOuterHtml
members.doc:
Gets the outer (inner plus tags) HTML of this element.

var element = CKEDITOR.dom.element.createFromHtml( '<div class="bold"><b>Example</b></div>' );
alert( element.getOuterHtml() ); // '<div class="bold"><b>Example</b></div>'
members.short_doc: Gets the outer (inner plus tags) HTML of this element. ...

members.name: getParent
members.doc:
Gets the parent element for this node.

var node = editor.document.getBody().getFirst();
var parent = node.getParent();
alert( parent.getName() ); // 'body'

params.name: allowFragmentParent
params.doc: Consider also parent node that is of fragment type CKEDITOR.NODE_DOCUMENT_FRAGMENT.

members.short_doc: Gets the parent element for this node. ...

members.name: getParents
members.doc:
Returns array containing node parents and node itself. By default nodes are in descending order.

// Assuming that body has paragraph as first child.
var node = editor.document.getBody().getFirst();
var parents = node.getParents();
alert( parents[ 0 ].getName() + ',' + parents[ 2 ].getName() ); // 'html,p'
members.short_doc: Returns array containing node parents and node itself. ...

members.name: getPosition
members.doc: @todo
members.short_doc: @todo ...

members.name: getPositionedAncestor
members.doc: Gets closest positioned (position != static) ancestor.
members.short_doc: Gets closest positioned (position != static) ancestor. ...

members.name: getPrevious
members.doc:
Gets the node that preceed this element in its parent's child list.

var element = CKEDITOR.dom.element.createFromHtml( '<div><i>prev</i><b>Example</b></div>' );
var first = element.getLast().getPrev();
alert( first.getName() ); // 'i'

return.name: return
return.doc: The previous node or null if not available.

members.short_doc: Gets the node that preceed this element in its parent's child list. ...

members.name: getPrivate
members.doc:
Get the private _ object which is bound to the native DOM object using getCustomData.

var elementA = new CKEDITOR.dom.element( nativeElement );
elementA.getPrivate().value = 1;
...
var elementB = new CKEDITOR.dom.element( nativeElement );
elementB.getPrivate().value; // 1
members.short_doc:
Get the private _ object which is bound to the native
DOM object using getCustomData. ...

members.doc: Gets the element size, possibly considering the box model.

params.name: isBorderBox
params.doc: Get the size based on the border box model.

members.name: getTabIndex
members.doc:
Gets the computed tabindex for this element.

var element = CKEDITOR.document.getById( 'myDiv' );
alert( element.getTabIndex() ); // (e.g.) '-1'
members.short_doc: Gets the computed tabindex for this element. ...

members.name: getText
members.doc:
Gets the text value of this element.

Only in IE (which uses innerText), <br> will cause linebreaks, and sucessive whitespaces (including line breaks) will be reduced to a single space. This behavior is ok for us, for now. It may change in the future.

var element = CKEDITOR.dom.element.createFromHtml( '<div>Sample <i>text</i>.</div>' );
alert( <b>element.getText()</b> ); // 'Sample text.'
members.short_doc: Gets the text value of this element. ...

members.name: getUniqueId
members.doc:
Gets an ID that can be used to identify this DOM object in the running session.

Note: This method does not work on text nodes prior to Internet Explorer 9.
members.short_doc:
Gets an ID that can be used to identify this DOM object in
the running session. ...

members.doc: Gets the value set to this element. This value is usually available for form field elements.
members.short_doc: Gets the value set to this element. ...

members.name: hasAttributes
members.doc:
Checks if the element has any defined attributes.

var element = CKEDITOR.dom.element.createFromHtml( '<div title="Test">Example</div>' );
alert( element.hasAttributes() ); // true

var element = CKEDITOR.dom.element.createFromHtml( '<div>Example</div>' );
alert( element.hasAttributes() ); // false
members.short_doc: Checks if the element has any defined attributes. ...

members.name: hasClass
members.doc: Checks if element has class name.
members.short_doc: Checks if element has class name. ...

members.name: hasListeners
members.doc:
Checks if there is any listener registered to a given event.

var myListener = function() { ... };
someObject.on( 'someEvent', myListener );
alert( someObject.hasListeners( 'someEvent' ) );    // true
alert( someObject.hasListeners( 'noEvent' ) );      // false
members.short_doc: Checks if there is any listener registered to a given event. ...

members.name: hasNext
members.doc: Check if node is succeeded by any sibling.
members.short_doc: Check if node is succeeded by any sibling. ...

members.name: hasPrevious
members.doc: Check if node is preceded by any sibling.
members.short_doc: Check if node is preceded by any sibling. ...

members.name: hide
members.doc:
Hides this element (sets display: none).

var element = CKEDITOR.document.getById( 'myElement' );
element.hide();
members.short_doc: Hides this element (sets display: none). ...

members.name: insertAfter
members.doc:
Inserts this element after a node.

var em = new CKEDITOR.dom.element( 'em' );
var strong = new CKEDITOR.dom.element( 'strong' );
strong.insertAfter( em );

// Result: '<em></em><strong></strong>'

params.name: node
params.doc: The node that will precede this element.

return.name: return
return.doc: The node preceding this one after insertion.

members.short_doc: Inserts this element after a node. ...

members.name: insertBefore
members.doc:
Inserts this element before a node.

var em = new CKEDITOR.dom.element( 'em' );
var strong = new CKEDITOR.dom.element( 'strong' );
strong.insertBefore( em );

// result: '<strong></strong><em></em>'

params.name: node
params.doc: The node that will succeed this element.

members.short_doc: Inserts this element before a node. ...

members.name: insertBeforeMe
members.doc:
Inserts node before this node.

var em = new CKEDITOR.dom.element( 'em' );
var strong = new CKEDITOR.dom.element( 'strong' );
strong.insertBeforeMe( em );

// result: '<em></em><strong></strong>'

params.name: node
params.doc: The node that will preceed this element.

members.short_doc: Inserts node before this node. ...

members.name: is
members.doc:
Checks if the element name matches the specified criteria.

var element = new CKEDITOR.element( 'span' );
alert( element.is( 'span' ) );          // true
alert( element.is( 'p', 'span' ) );     // true
alert( element.is( 'p' ) );             // false
alert( element.is( 'p', 'div' ) );      // false
alert( element.is( { p:1,span:1 } ) );  // true

params.name: name
params.doc: One or more names to be checked, or a CKEDITOR.dtd object.

return.name: return
return.doc: true if the element name matches any of the names.

members.short_doc: Checks if the element name matches the specified criteria. ...

members.name: isBlockBoundary
members.doc: Checks whether element is displayed as a block.

params.name: customNodeNames
params.doc: Custom list of nodes which will extend default CKEDITOR.dtd.$block list.

members.short_doc: Checks whether element is displayed as a block. ...

members.name: isEditable
members.doc: Decide whether one element is able to receive cursor.

params.name: textCursor
params.doc: Only consider element that could receive text child.

members.short_doc: Decide whether one element is able to receive cursor. ...

members.name: isEmptyInlineRemoveable
members.doc: Whether it's an empty inline elements which has no visual impact when removed.
members.short_doc: Whether it's an empty inline elements which has no visual impact when removed. ...

members.name: isIdentical
members.doc:
Compare this element's inner html, tag name, attributes, etc. with other one.

See W3C's DOM Level 3 spec - node#isEqualNode for more details.
members.short_doc: Compare this element's inner html, tag name, attributes, etc. ...

members.name: isReadOnly
members.doc:
Checks if this node is read-only (should not be changed).

Note: When attributeCheck is not used, this method only work for elements that are already presented in the document, otherwise the result is not guaranteed, it's mainly for performance consideration.

// For the following HTML:
// <div contenteditable="false">Some <b>text</b></div>

// If "ele" is the above <div>
element.isReadOnly(); // true
members.short_doc: Checks if this node is read-only (should not be changed). ...

members.name: isVisible
members.doc: Checks if this element is visible. May not work if the element is child of an element with visibility set to hidden, but works well on the great majority of cases.
members.short_doc: Checks if this element is visible. ...

members.name: ltrim
members.doc: @todo
members.short_doc: @todo ...

members.name: mergeSiblings
members.doc:
Merges sibling elements that are identical to this one.

Identical child elements are also merged. For example:

<b><i></i></b><b><i></i></b> => <b><i></i></b>

params.name: inlineOnly
params.doc: Allow only inline elements to be merged.

members.short_doc: Merges sibling elements that are identical to this one. ...

members.name: move
members.doc: @todo
members.short_doc: @todo ...

members.name: moveChildren
members.doc: Moves this element's children to the target element.

params.name: toStart
params.doc: Insert moved children at the beginning of the target element.

members.short_doc: Moves this element's children to the target element. ...

members.name: on
members.doc:
Registers a listener to a specific event in the current object.

someObject.on( 'someEvent', function() {
    alert( this == someObject );        // true
} );

someObject.on( 'someEvent', function() {
    alert( this == anotherObject );     // true
}, anotherObject );

someObject.on( 'someEvent', function( event ) {
    alert( event.listenerData );        // 'Example'
}, null, 'Example' );

someObject.on( 'someEvent', function() { ... } );                       // 2nd called
someObject.on( 'someEvent', function() { ... }, null, null, 100 );      // 3rd called
someObject.on( 'someEvent', function() { ... }, null, null, 1 );        // 1st called

params.name: listenerFunction
params.doc: The function listening to the event. A single CKEDITOR.eventInfo object instanced is passed to this function containing all the event data.

params.name: scopeObj
params.doc: The object used to scope the listener call (the this object). If omitted, the current object is used.

params.name: listenerData
params.doc: Data to be sent as the CKEDITOR.eventInfo.listenerData when calling the listener.

params.name: priority
params.doc: The listener priority. Lower priority listeners are called first. Listeners with the same priority value are called in registration order.

return.name: return
return.doc: An object containing the removeListener function, which can be used to remove the listener at any time.

members.short_doc: Registers a listener to a specific event in the current object. ...

members.name: once
members.doc:
Similiar with on but the listener will be called only once upon the next event firing.

@see CKEDITOR.event.on
members.short_doc: Similiar with on but the listener will be called only once upon the next event firing. ...

members.name: remove
members.doc:
Removes this node from the document DOM.

var element = CKEDITOR.document.getById( 'MyElement' );
element.remove();

params.name: preserveChildren
params.doc: Indicates that the children elements must remain in the document, removing only the outer tags.

members.short_doc: Removes this node from the document DOM. ...

members.name: removeAllListeners
members.doc:
Removes any listener set on this object.

To avoid memory leaks we must assure that there are no references left after the object is no longer needed.
members.short_doc: Removes any listener set on this object. ...

members.name: removeAttribute
members.doc:
Removes an attribute from the element.

var element = CKEDITOR.dom.element.createFromHtml( '<div class="classA"></div>' );
element.removeAttribute( 'class' );
members.short_doc: Removes an attribute from the element. ...

members.name: removeAttributes
members.doc: Removes all element's attributes or just given ones.
members.short_doc: Removes all element's attributes or just given ones. ...

members.name: removeClass
members.doc:
Removes a CSS class name from the elements classes. Other classes remain untouched.

var element = new CKEDITOR.dom.element( 'div' );
element.addClass( 'classA' );       // <div class="classA">
element.addClass( 'classB' );       // <div class="classA classB">
element.removeClass( 'classA' );    // <div class="classB">
element.removeClass( 'classB' );    // <div>

params.name: className
params.doc: The name of the class to remove.

members.short_doc: Removes a CSS class name from the elements classes. ...

members.name: removeCustomData
members.doc: Removes the value in data slot under given key.
members.short_doc: Removes the value in data slot under given key. ...

members.name: removeListener
members.doc:
Unregisters a listener function from being called at the specified event. No errors are thrown if the listener has not been registered previously.

var myListener = function() { ... };
someObject.on( 'someEvent', myListener );
someObject.fire( 'someEvent' );                 // myListener called.
someObject.removeListener( 'someEvent', myListener );
someObject.fire( 'someEvent' );                 // myListener not called.
members.short_doc:
Unregisters a listener function from being called at the specified
event. ...

members.name: removeStyle
members.doc:
Removes a style from the element.

var element = CKEDITOR.dom.element.createFromHtml( '<div style="display:none"></div>' );
element.removeStyle( 'display' );
members.short_doc: Removes a style from the element. ...

members.name: renameNode
members.doc: Changes the tag name of the current element.
members.short_doc: Changes the tag name of the current element. ...

members.name: replace
members.doc: @todo
members.short_doc: @todo ...

members.name: rtrim
members.doc: @todo
members.short_doc: @todo ...

members.name: scrollIntoParent
members.doc: Make any page element visible inside one of the ancestors by scrolling the parent.

params.name: alignToTop
params.doc: Align the element's top side with the container's when true is specified; align the bottom with viewport bottom when false is specified. Otherwise scroll on either side with the minimum amount to show the element.

members.short_doc: Make any page element visible inside one of the ancestors by scrolling the parent. ...

members.name: scrollIntoView
members.doc: Make any page element visible inside the browser viewport.
members.short_doc: Make any page element visible inside the browser viewport. ...

members.name: setAttribute
members.doc:
Sets the value of an element attribute.

var element = CKEDITOR.document.getById( 'myElement' );
element.setAttribute( 'class', 'myClass' );
element.setAttribute( 'title', 'This is an example' );

params.name: value
params.doc: The value to be set to the attribute.

members.short_doc: Sets the value of an element attribute. ...

members.name: setAttributes
members.doc:
Sets the value of several element attributes.

var element = CKEDITOR.document.getById( 'myElement' );
element.setAttributes( {
    'class':    'myClass',
    title:      'This is an example'
} );

params.name: attributesPairs
params.doc: An object containing the names and values of the attributes.

members.short_doc: Sets the value of several element attributes. ...

members.name: setCustomData
members.doc:
Sets a data slot value for this object. These values are shared by all instances pointing to that same DOM object.

Note: The created data slot is only guarantied to be available on this unique dom node, thus any wish to continue access it from other element clones (either created by clone node or from innerHtml) will fail, for such usage, please use CKEDITOR.dom.element.setAttribute instead.

Note: This method does not work on text nodes prior to Internet Explorer 9.

var element = new CKEDITOR.dom.element( 'span' );
element.setCustomData( 'hasCustomData', true );

params.name: key
params.doc: A key used to identify the data slot.

params.name: value
params.doc: The value to set to the data slot.

members.short_doc: Sets a data slot value for this object. ...

members.name: setData
members.doc: Sets the editable data. The data will be passed through the CKEDITOR.editor.dataProcessor and the CKEDITOR.editor.filter. This ensures that the data was filtered and prepared to be edited like the editor data.
members.short_doc: Sets the editable data. ...

members.name: setHtml
members.doc:
Sets the inner HTML of this element.

var p = new CKEDITOR.dom.element( 'p' );
p.setHtml( '<b>Inner</b> HTML' );

// Result: '<p><b>Inner</b> HTML</p>'

params.name: html
params.doc: The HTML to be set for this element.

members.short_doc: Sets the inner HTML of this element. ...

members.name: setOpacity
members.doc:
Sets the opacity of an element.

var element = CKEDITOR.document.getById( 'myElement' );
element.setOpacity( 0.75 );
members.short_doc: Sets the opacity of an element. ...

members.name: setSize
members.doc: Sets the element size considering the box model.

params.name: isBorderBox
params.doc: Apply the size based on the border box model.

members.short_doc: Sets the element size considering the box model. ...

members.name: setState
members.doc:
Switch the class attribute to reflect one of the triple states of an element in one of CKEDITOR.TRISTATE_ON, CKEDITOR.TRISTATE_OFF or CKEDITOR.TRISTATE_DISABLED.

link.setState( CKEDITOR.TRISTATE_ON );
// <a class="cke_on" aria-pressed="true">...</a>
link.setState( CKEDITOR.TRISTATE_OFF );
// <a class="cke_off">...</a>
link.setState( CKEDITOR.TRISTATE_DISABLED );
// <a class="cke_disabled" aria-disabled="true">...</a>

span.setState( CKEDITOR.TRISTATE_ON, 'cke_button' );
// <span class="cke_button_on">...</span>

params.name: state
params.doc: Indicate the element state. One of CKEDITOR.TRISTATE_ON, CKEDITOR.TRISTATE_OFF, CKEDITOR.TRISTATE_DISABLED.

params.name: base
params.doc: The prefix apply to each of the state class name.

params.name: useAria
params.doc: Whether toggle the ARIA state attributes besides of class name change.

members.short_doc:
Switch the class attribute to reflect one of the triple states of an
element in one of CKEDITOR.TRISTATE_ON, CKEDITOR...

members.name: setStyle
members.doc:
Sets the value of an element style.

var element = CKEDITOR.document.getById( 'myElement' );
element.setStyle( 'background-color', '#ff0000' );
element.setStyle( 'margin-top', '10px' );
element.setStyle( 'float', 'right' );

params.name: name
params.doc: The name of the style. The CSS naming notation must be used (e.g. background-color).

params.name: value
params.doc: The value to be set to the style.

members.short_doc: Sets the value of an element style. ...

members.name: setStyles
members.doc:
Sets the value of several element styles.

var element = CKEDITOR.document.getById( 'myElement' );
element.setStyles( {
    position:   'absolute',
    float:      'right'
} );

params.name: stylesPairs
params.doc: An object containing the names and values of the styles.

members.short_doc: Sets the value of several element styles. ...

members.name: setText
members.doc:
Sets the element contents as plain text.

var element = new CKEDITOR.dom.element( 'div' );
element.setText( 'A > B & C < D' );
alert( element.innerHTML ); // 'A > B & C < D'
members.short_doc: Sets the element contents as plain text. ...

members.name: setValue
members.doc: Sets the element value. This function is usually used with form field element.
members.short_doc: Sets the element value. ...

members.name: show
members.doc:
Shows this element (displays it).

var element = CKEDITOR.document.getById( 'myElement' );
element.show();
members.short_doc: Shows this element (displays it). ...

members.doc: @todo
members.short_doc: @todo ...

members.name: unselectable
members.doc:
Makes the element and its children unselectable.

var element = CKEDITOR.document.getById( 'myElement' );
element.unselectable();
members.short_doc: Makes the element and its children unselectable. ...

short_doc: The wrapper class for editable elements inside widgets. ...
